channel.title: Politics on Dāvis Vilcāns
channel.description: Recent content in Politics on Dāvis Vilcāns

item.title: Linux, Python & AI: Analysis of Political Donations
item.description: About the analysis I sought to exercise my data analysis skills with an intriguing dataset. I wanted to focus on data analysis rather than data collection, so I needed interesting and readily accessible data. It turns out that the KNAB party finance database offers the convenience of extracting and storing all the information using just a web browser. To preserve all the information, I needed five iterations due to the large volume of data, dividing the information by years.

item.title: Quiz: World Events
item.description: A little experiment with Hugo Quizdown implementation and localization --- primary_color: green secondary_color: lightgray text_color: black shuffle_questions: true --- ## Muslim country ruled by women: For the past 33 years this muslim country has been led by female prime ministers. > One of the most densely populated countries in the world – 1'342 people/km². 1. [ ] Albania > The correct answer is Bangladesh. 2. [ ] Algeria > The correct answer is Bangladesh.

item.title: Redefining patriotism
item.description: Haters vs. Innovators A week ago the newly appointed minister of culture of Latvia Ms.Agnese Logina gave an interview where she emphasized the need to redefine patriotism in order to promote a more inclusive society, a society where the feeling of belonging transcends ethnic characteristics, where people should find a sense of home and acceptance irrespective of their cultural background. However, Ms.Logina’s visionary call to redefine patriotism in the pursuit of a more inclusive society was met with harsh and unfounded criticism.

item.title: Internet censorship in Latvia
item.description: A while ago while browsing the Internet I came accross a news article with a list of websites that are apparently blocked in Latvia. When I tried to open some of these websites from my laptop, I was very disappointed. Everything was working. My Internet connection is provided by one of the largest local ISP’s and I am not using VPN’s or other similar solutions. It made me curious so I decided to investigate a little bit.
